definition: the original name of 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1], Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3]
grandson/descendant
surname Sun
language/culture/writing/formal/literary/gentle/(old) classifier for coins/Kangxi radical 67
surname Wen

sentences.english: For the Sun Yat-sen led the revolution, when many Japanese friends to support him.
sentences.chinese: 对于领导革命的孙文，当年有许多日本友人支持他。

sentences.english: Sun Yat-sen was a prominent dissident who had been exiled from China.
sentences.chinese: 孙文是从中国流亡的一位著名不同政见者。

definition: Huang Xing (1874-1916), revolutionary politician, close collaborator of Sun Yat-sen, prominent in the 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4], murdered in Shanghai in 1916
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Song Jiaoren (1882-1913), politician of the revolutionary party involved in the 1911 Xinhai revolution, murdered in Shanghai in 1913
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
Chen Tianhua (1875-1905), anti-Qing revolutionary from Hunan, drowned himself in Japan in 1905
Kang Youwei (1858-1927), Confucian intellectual, educator and would-be reformer, main leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912
opposing Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 in War of national protection 1915-1916/same as 反袁鬥爭|反袁斗争
Tang Shaoyi (1862-1939), politician and diplomat
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
Xiong Chengji (1887-1910), anti-Qing revolutionary and martyr
Revive China Society, founded by Dr Sun Yat-sen 孫中山|孙中山 in 1894 in Honolulu
Cao Kun (1862-1938), one of the Northern Warlords
Zhang Taiyan 章太炎 (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
Cai E (1882-1916), originator of the National protection army of 1915
